title: LMAO Sett
body:
When he came out on the PBE, I thought he was alright (I actually hadn't seen his entire kit)
Now, I took some time to really see what his kit really was about. Then I checked winrates because why not:

TOP SETT HAS A 56% WR WITH 18% PR AND 54% BAN. WHAT THE FUCK
He is 2nd on jungle with a 53% wr.
On mid he has like 54% wr but with 0.9% pick rate.

Just by LOOKING at his kit, by GLANCING, you can see what's wrong with it. Why does he have health regen based on missing health? seriously, why? He has laughably low cooldowns on his W and Q. Like what in the world are these devs thinking? Are they **trying** to push people away from this game?

He has more than 50% wr in EVERY rank except for challenger. Most are actually 55% winrate.

replies.body:
> [{quoted}](name=Nea104,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=1JdOkibh,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2020-01-25T15:53:01.668+0000)
>
> Meanwhile:
> - [Sett is the most balanced champion on release since forever](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/E5vVALQ3-sett-is-the-most-balanced-champion-on-release-since-forever)
> - [Sett's actually making me enjoy league again after a year and a half](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/apRimAPN-setts-actually-making-me-enjoy-league-again-after-a-year-and-a-half)
> - [Sett, is the best champ in the game](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/general-discussion/yqGbAtmT-sett-is-the-best-champ-in-the-game)
> 
> Some people never learn :D And this company relies on them, sadly.

Glad that now more people are aware of this further failure in balancing ;)

So, just as a recap, their latest releases:

{{champion:875}} :
**55%** WR after **a couple of weeks**.

{{champion:523}} :
supposed to be "the **hardest** champion to play in LoL"; ended up being just a smashing-buttons broken **joke**.

{{champion:235}} :
an "innovative" **support**; warnings about another "Pyke 2.0" weren't listen; now she's better as ADC, strong in lane and scaling.

Enjoy S10 :D
Np, S11 will be better.

I destroyed a sett top lane with illaoi. It was so funny. I had so much healing that he couldn't even try to 1v1 me. The worst part was that he never dodged my E so he was always taking damage. And when he got too close I used my nearby tenticle and hit him with my W for good damage. He had to keep recalling back to base.. I outfarmed him and locked down his lane. It was good stuff.
anecdote < statistics

As true as that is, how a champion feels to play against matters too. Sona and Jinx don’t feel overpowered, but statistically they are. Likewise, Akali is statistically awful but can feel oppressive and overbearing. Stats tell most of the story, but champion-feel is the colour text that completes the narrative.

Sett literally had a gamebreaking bug that put his winrate at the start of this patch, with the bug, at 58%, but now that the bug has been hotfixed out it's been slowly going down and down, now at a 54%. So likely he's pretty balanced now his winrate just was thrown off because of the bug, it's gon e and now its becoming reasonable. Sett is balanced
That's probably because he has to stand still a lot to do his damage, and Illaoi punishes that super hard.
So does all of top lane, and anyone with skillshots.  Hell, Illaoi's E is probably the single hardest skillshot to land, for that matter.

It's easy if they have to stand still in melee range for a lengthy period of time to fight you, which Set does.

If he ever tries to do anything besides W poke, you hit E on him then start swinging.
Beat cancer with even bigger cancer, smart.
Turns out his win rate is the result of a bug.
Source?

Do you both not realize Volibear is an animal in a 1v1 in lane? His lvl 2-11 is insane and there's few champs that can come anywhere near soloing him.

Did you even consider he may have flipped Sett during Sett w? Thus guaranteeing he dodges the damage? Or are you just trying to flame?

> [{quoted}](name=ChiefDovahkin,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=fwy7ywQE,comment-id=001100000001,timestamp=2020-01-26T19:45:24.074+0000)

Lmao all I read is Sett is easily outplayed and Voli has needed nerfs for ages, but has been ignored and allowed to be broken cause he is boring to play for most people.

> [{quoted}](name=Bultz,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=fwy7ywQE,comment-id=0011000000010000,timestamp=2020-01-26T20:13:09.723+0000)

But that's true. If Voli didn't have such a linear kit and was more enjoyable his early game damage probably would've been nerfed by now. Sett also is easy to outplay, but your pick against him gates it. If you don't have any movement abilities, you can't easily dodge w. If you do and dodge w, you win every trade.

> [{quoted}](name=ChiefDovahkin,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=fwy7ywQE,comment-id=00110000000100000000,timestamp=2020-01-26T20:35:25.651+0000)

Sett also is easy to outplay, but your pick against him gates it. If you don't have any movement abilities, you can't easily dodge w. If you do and dodge w, you win every trade.

So you are saying he is balanced and has room to outplay. What we have been saying the entire time...

there's a difference.

counterpick SHOULD NEVER BE the only counter to a champion, while counters should play a role, if they're the only ones who's able to do something against a cham, that probably means that the champion is broken/ poorly designed

> [{quoted}](name=rawiazam1,realm=EUNE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=fwy7ywQE,comment-id=0011000000010000000000000000,timestamp=2020-01-27T01:01:36.454+0000)

{{sticker:zombie-brand-mindblown}} {{sticker:zombie-brand-facepalm}} Just reread your own statement.

> [{quoted}](name=Bultz,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=fwy7ywQE,comment-id=00110000000100000000000000000000,timestamp=2020-01-27T01:15:01.131+0000)

I mean he kinda has a point. You shouldny be FORCED to play a champ just because they have a certain champ. You should be able to pick and average champ and atleast go even or be a bit behind

Game shouldn't be balanced around pro play.  What's not op in a 5v5 scenario with a well-coordinated team at the top of the game's skill level is MUCH different than what's OP in solo queue among disorganized chucklefucks all two deaths away from flaming each other.

> [{quoted}](name=The Whamboozler,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=fwy7ywQE,comment-id=00110001,timestamp=2020-01-27T01:29:51.611+0000)
>
> Game shouldn't be balanced around pro play.  What's not op in a 5v5 scenario with a well-coordinated team at the top of the game's skill level is MUCH different than what's OP in solo queue among disorganized chucklefucks all two deaths away from flaming each other.

Yes, it should be balanced around whiny kids who have no micro or macro play....

Um... it should be balanced around the majority of players.  so yes, if 85% of the players are whiny kids with no macro, that's the baseline they should probably go by.  Why make the game worse for the majority of it's players to make it better for like.... what?  150 people?  200?  How many high tier e-sports players ARE there?  

I'll also assume considering your condescending tone that you consider yourself "high tier" and above these so-called whiny kids that every player seems to hate while also thinking they're superior to.  I swear, this game is like 90% Dunning Kruger Effect.

> [{quoted}](name=Nazgul10,realm=EUNE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=fwy7ywQE,comment-id=,timestamp=2020-01-26T07:53:55.126+0000)
>
> When he came out on the PBE, I thought he was alright (I actually hadn't seen his entire kit)
> Now, I took some time to really see what his kit really was about. Then I checked winrates because why not:
> 
> TOP SETT HAS A 56% WR WITH 18% PR AND 54% BAN. WHAT THE FUCK
> He is 2nd on jungle with a 53% wr.
> On mid he has like 54% wr but with 0.9% pick rate.
> 
> Just by LOOKING at his kit, by GLANCING, you can see what's wrong with it. Why does he have health regen based on missing health? seriously, why? He has laughably low cooldowns on his W and Q. Like what in the world are these devs thinking? Are they **trying** to push people away from this game?
> 
> He has more than 50% wr in EVERY rank except for challenger. Most are actually 55% winrate.

The health regen is fine. His damage is overtuned. I'd rather he stay a durable fighter that with a good ult can punish heavy frontlines, but his Q and W don't need to be doing as much damage as they currently do.

> [{quoted}](name=Crescent Dusk,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=fwy7ywQE,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2020-01-26T09:40:31.452+0000)
>
> The health regen is fine. His damage is overtuned. I'd rather he stay a durable fighter that with a good ult can punish heavy frontlines, but his Q and W don't need to be doing as much damage as they currently do.


I'd argue beating down frontlines with most of his kit is fine if that's supposed to be his thing, like Trundle, but shouldn't get backline access. Which if he ults a tank towards the backline and uses E, has a range of 1290-caitlyn has 1300 on her attack when you get snared in a trap for reference. Cut back his W/E range, and scale back the hp regen, because right now he can poke out a range champ with true damage-while also having better regen than Garen for 80% of the game, and still giving him a run for his money later. This means you can't poke him out with ranged abilities, while still receiving poke, and melee's are a joke to him.

Making a champ that does REALLY good vs an archtype, in this case tanky melees-encompassing bruisers and tanks-is fine if other classes can squash him. This SHOULD be ranged, but due to the issues I just mentioned, they too have a difficult time.

I'd rather see him excel in an area, be known for it, but have those glaring flaws, then to see numbers nerfed so he just becomes so-so in every situation.

> [{quoted}](name=Vectros,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=fwy7ywQE,comment-id=00000001,timestamp=2020-01-26T22:03:52.901+0000)
>
> I'd argue beating down frontlines with most of his kit is fine if that's supposed to be his thing, like Trundle, but shouldn't get backline access. Which if he ults a tank towards the backline and uses E, has a range of 1290-caitlyn has 1300 on her attack when you get snared in a trap for reference. Cut back his W/E range, and scale back the hp regen, because right now he can poke out a range champ with true damage-while also having better regen than Garen for 80% of the game, and still giving him a run for his money later. This means you can't poke him out with ranged abilities, while still receiving poke, and melee's are a joke to him.
> 
> Making a champ that does REALLY good vs an archtype, in this case tanky melees-encompassing bruisers and tanks-is fine if other classes can squash him. This SHOULD be ranged, but due to the issues I just mentioned, they too have a difficult time.
> 
> I'd rather see him excel in an area, be known for it, but have those glaring flaws, then to see numbers nerfed so he just becomes so-so in every situation.

That is laughable, he should absolutely have access to the back line. If we wanted to play your way we could just use Darius. The safest and hardest hitting champions in game, ranged adc, should not be allowed to sit back and gun people down. Also with him not have a solid gap closer, you are 100% wrong about ranged champions not being able to poke him.

> [{quoted}](name=Bultz,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=fwy7ywQE,comment-id=000000010001,timestamp=2020-01-26T23:41:43.494+0000)
>
> That is laughable, he should absolutely have access to the back line. If we wanted to play your way we could just use Darius. The safest and hardest hitting champions in game, ranged adc, should not be allowed to sit back and gun people down. Also with him not have a solid gap closer, you are 100% wrong about ranged champions not being able to poke him.

Since when were juggernauts meant to access the back line? Do you even know what juggernaut is? If we wanted to play my way, we'd go Darius...you say this, as if he's the ONLY one with this playstyle, when there's probably a dozen, maybe two dozen, champions who play like this.

I agree ADC's shouldn't be able to gun people down without recourse. Trust me, I hate ADC role more than any other-as a bruiser AKA juggernaut player, I also know it's not MY job to reach them. That's for divers and assassins, and some artillery mages to do. If I am able to reach the backline, while also being tanky, while also putting out immense damage, where is my weakness?

As for the poking, even if he's poked, his regen is literally up there with Garen-better early game given Garen has to wait 7 seconds to have it kick in. 

Now, I'm not trying to say *EVERY* ranged champion has problems. There will be a few with very, very long range poke that can stay out of his poke and farm. But given there's like, 3 champions that truly have a good winrate against him in lane, statistically he's a very strong laner, with great teamfight potential. Again, he gets backline access by utilizing a frontliner with his ult, followed by his E to pull them to him. It's a bit unconventional, but it's worked for me multiple times, and his statistics seem to back this as well.

I'm not trying to make him weak, but he is in fact in the same class as Darius-Juggernaut. As such he should have the same job-slow, very durable, high damage threat. He moves slow, but has that potential backline access most champions simply don't get.

It's not as bad 1 vs 1 as far as access goes since you do have to get close for the initial grab, so don't confuse this please-I'm referring to team fights.

> [{quoted}](name=Vectros,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=fwy7ywQE,comment-id=00000001,timestamp=2020-01-26T22:03:52.901+0000)
>
> I'd argue beating down frontlines with most of his kit is fine if that's supposed to be his thing, like Trundle, but shouldn't get backline access. Which if he ults a tank towards the backline and uses E, has a range of 1290-caitlyn has 1300 on her attack when you get snared in a trap for reference. Cut back his W/E range, and scale back the hp regen, because right now he can poke out a range champ with true damage-while also having better regen than Garen for 80% of the game, and still giving him a run for his money later. This means you can't poke him out with ranged abilities, while still receiving poke, and melee's are a joke to him.
> 
> Making a champ that does REALLY good vs an archtype, in this case tanky melees-encompassing bruisers and tanks-is fine if other classes can squash him. This SHOULD be ranged, but due to the issues I just mentioned, they too have a difficult time.
> 
> I'd rather see him excel in an area, be known for it, but have those glaring flaws, then to see numbers nerfed so he just becomes so-so in every situation.

He gets dumptered by Quinn, Tristana, a halfway decent Vayne as well. If you want to be extra-jackass, Kalista dumpsters him as she does Illaoi. Can probably take Karma top into him as well.

> [{quoted}](name=Crescent Dusk,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=fwy7ywQE,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2020-01-26T09:40:31.452+0000)
>
> The health regen is fine. His damage is overtuned. I'd rather he stay a durable fighter that with a good ult can punish heavy frontlines, but his Q and W don't need to be doing as much damage as they currently do.

he took out 3 of our allies from 1% hp last game and proceeded to do tryndamere speed split but with less counter.

Honestly tho, his fast animations and aa resets are his biggest strength.

> Why does he have health regen based on missing health?

While his passive is fine for me. Someone think otherwise:
{{champion:36}} "Mundo sad."

(But maybe it means that Mundo Rework is in the works and might be released for the second half of the year)

Just make W physical damage.

And see how it goes from there
The W is physical damage, it only does true damage in a tiny little line. Everyone forgets you can dodge it
WOuldnt that be cool if RIot had a Public Beta Environment to test that out?

Imagine complaining about a champion that has to walk up to you and has no dashes. Imagine complaining about a skill that has a huge wind up that you can walk out of. Imagine complaining about Sett when ashe exists in the game.
People used to do it about Trundle and he got hard nerfed. He also doesn't have sustain, durability or damage anywhere near Sett's level, he never has. Both are juggernauts.

honestly im surprised by how well sett does.
i know his basestats are insane but idk.

1. he isnt as overloaded as other champs
2. he has almost no mobility
3. his passive lifereg isnt THAT high before lv 11 and in a burst meta lifereg really isnt that strong

his w starts with 16 sec cooldown which is okay.
He only feels more fair because it’s not dash dash dead like assassins. He is still too powerful.

The health regen was designed to help him through ranged matchups granted he has no functional way to lane against range.  I still think they should pull power out of his w and give it to the rest of his kit, because when you stop and look at the numbers, the rest of his kit really isn’t that great.  His ultimate is deceptively weak because the damage falloff begins insanely quickly.

I played Teemo against him twice.  I couldn't even get him below half hp while he was building full AD and I was harassing him non stop and then he drops a W on me to take 1/3 hp with no grit built up.  I actually felt like Sett, the definition of immobile, was a hard counter to Teemo, the definition of a bully to immobile champions.  I'm fine with Sett either being able to deal with poke or being able to brawl it out with other melees but he shouldn't be able to do both.  Either scale back his %hp damage to give other melees a chance or his regen to give ranged a chance.  He shouldn't get to bully both ranged and melee champions as well as scale.

Side note....a 0 grit random W poke at level 1 does 109 true damage.

The fact that you lost to a melee champion with no gap closer who relies on aa whose w is incredibly well telegraphed with a long enough cast time to walk out of range of its true damage as teemo of all champions makes me think that L was on you.

... His Q and R are the only abilities that have a low CD.... W is at best 10s before CDR and is maxed second, which is on the higher end for non CC abilities. His Q is his bread and butter, and only actual spamable ability, and is essentially an empowered auto reset on a melee champ. His ult is low CD compared to other ults, but is still not lux levels of spam. Its once per fight.

40% cdr rush W max Sett is completely busted
4,8 sec cd, shield decaying over 3 seconds.
You can play him with fucking lucidity boots like riven and stomp your opponents. LUL
{{item:3078}} {{item:3158}} {{item:3067}}

> [{quoted}](name=Salty Mc Feed,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=fwy7ywQE,comment-id=00290001,timestamp=2020-01-28T08:23:56.030+0000)
>
> 40% cdr rush W max Sett is completely busted
> 4,8 sec cd, shield decaying over 3 seconds.
> You can play him with fucking lucidity boots like riven and stomp your opponents. LUL
> {{item:3078}} {{item:3158}} {{item:3067}}

Triforce is the most expensive item in the game, lucidity boots suck in comparison to other boots. Youre already looking at mid game with these items, and realistically would only have 30% CDR because youd be buying merc or tabi.
Please stop being a contrarian that makes no fucking sense. You clearly don't know what you are talking about and you have almost no experience with the champion. LOL

> [{quoted}](name=Salty Mc Feed,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=fwy7ywQE,comment-id=0029000100000000,timestamp=2020-01-28T09:19:03.443+0000)
>
> Please stop being a contrarian that makes no fucking sense. You clearly don't know what you are talking about and you have almost no experience with the champion. LOL

10% CDR on boots in no way would serve you better than literally any other option of boots on sett.

MR and tenacity so you can live longer and get onto your opponent easier and stay there given you have no mobility

AR and Damage Reduction to live long enough and amplify your shield power from W

Even swifties and mobis would end up being better for either better ganks or, again, GETTING ONTO YOUR TARGET.

The AS from zerkers is also likely better for overall damage. 10% CDR would mainly benefit Q, youre not going to be using W twice in a fight (as youll be dead by the time it was worth using again), and E is likely a one off as well. 

Theres no major reason to run CDR boots over anything else. Sett has 2 viable options for 20% CDR, potentially 3 with how overbuffed FH is this patch, and easy access to 10% items in quick order.

Did you actually just say that Trinity Force is expensive but Lucidity boots is bad even though the other boots are more expensive and then you suggest Frozen Heart of all inefficient items you could possibly buy on a manaless champion? Absolutely no point in trying to reason with you. Not to mention that you go around and tell people Sett has to max Q when most players max W because it's too good, which is extremely obvious, given the base (true) damage and the cooldown reduction from 18 to 8 seconds. LMAO
